sentences.english: He suffered a loss of prestige when the scandal was publicized .
sentences.chinese: 這件醜事公開後他便威信掃地。

sentences.english: Since this man is my guest, don't do this disgraceful thing.
sentences.chinese: 這人既然進了我的家，你們就不要行這醜事。

sentences.english: 1：We spent weeks trying to dig up dirt on this guy.
sentences.chinese: 我們幾星期來都在竭力挖那傢伙的醜事。

sentences.english: Melvin has even managed to dig up some dirt on the inscrutable Pyongyang Metro —that’s the system’s Puhung station in the photo.
sentences.chinese: 梅爾文甚至還挖掘出了平壤地鐵的一點醜事。

sentences.english: Those who avoid great sins and shameful deeds, only (falling into) small faults, - verily thy Lord is ample in forgiveness.
sentences.chinese: 遠離大罪和醜事，但犯小罪者，你的主確是寬宥的。

sentences.english: The whole village knew about the scandal.
sentences.chinese: 全村人都知道那件醜事了。

sentences.english: It would be a scandal to leave diagnosed patients without treatment".
sentences.chinese: 將病人診斷出來而不加治療是一件醜事。

sentences.english: You don't want to hush-hush his scandal to me.
sentences.chinese: 你別想對我隱瞞他的醜事。

sentences.english: The villagers knew about the scandal.
sentences.chinese: 村子裏的居民知道這件醜事。

sentences.english: The media for their folly to question the imperial palace fee?
sentences.chinese: 媒體質疑故宮爲掩醜事給封口費？

sentences.english: The public has an appetite for scandal.
sentences.chinese: 公衆對醜事總是喜聞樂道。

definition: to plot and kill sb for his property (idiom); to murder for money
to forget favors and violate justice (idiom); ingratitude to a friend/to kick a benefactor in the teeth
to condemn in speech and in writing (idiom)/to denounce by word and pen
lit. chasing the wind and clutching at shadows (idiom); fig. groundless accusations/to act on hearsay evidence
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
to imitate the dog and steal chicken (idiom)/to pilfer/to dally with women/to have affairs
to kill sb for his property (idiom); to murder for money
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
to cause an accident/to make trouble/to get into trouble
